Reviews.Title: “good located, no thrills hotel in key position in Paris”
Reviews.Author: chrissassen
Reviews.Content: I've been there many times in the last 8 years and to be honest never been disappointed. Avoid first or second floor rooms to the street side, and others close to the elevator on the other floor if you want to sleep peacefully. Otherwise, goor price/quality ratio, certainly in this "arrondissement". Breakfast of good quality, but you must enjoy having it in the basement. Excellent personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days before the Paris half marathon. Location excellent. hotel clean and comfortable, staff very helpful - allowed us a late departure for showering. breakfast simple but very sufficient. defintely a recommend

Reviews.Title: “Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: jillypops55
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean and comfortable. Rooms quite spacious by Paris standards. Great position but not bothered by traffic noise due to the shutters. Hotel agreed to extending checkout by an hour despite claiming to be fully booked. Only complaint was the bed has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Stylish,spacious& clean rooms. Staff very helpful. We would stay there again...I can't wait to come back! There was a very nice gentleman in the breakfast room who noticed we had not made it down- so he called our room and said he had saved some croissants for us and he would bring them up with some coffee ect to our room. Now that was nice :).

Reviews.Title: “" A home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: patriciaAFM
Reviews.Content: Le Lavoisier is the perfect place to feel "home away from home". Actually my home is pretty nice, and so is this charming small hotel. Staff are very helpful ( yes, even the new shy guy at reception did great in finding us champagne and two glasses for an early evening drink in the room : THANKS ). The rooms are average size but comfortable and very clean. We live about 2 hours outside of Paris and can recommand this as the perfect Parisien "pied à terre' : well located, nearby secure and clean parking, close to subway station. Oh, about breakfast : we LOVE breakfast during the week ( with fresh orange juice ..... ) but the Sunday team do not seem to have their act together .... we agree

Reviews.Title: “A quiet boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: larryell
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Le Lavoisier is my hotel of choice either for business or pleasure. It is within easy walking distance of major tourist attractions without being a "tourist" hotel. The staff is very accommodating in scheduling any ground transportation as required. Suggest booking as early as possible to get the best pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique, reasonable option but not super”
Reviews.Author: Boonstra_Familiy
Reviews.Content: I always stay in the hotel as it is very close to our office in Paris. Good option for 1-3 nights, altough I found the rooms quite small for the price you pay (200 Euro for standard room). Rooms are nicely furnished with a somewhat smallish flatscreen (maximum 26 inch I think). There is a small sitting-area and a library where you can use the bar. Breakfast is very limited in my opinion, some baquette, a croissant and a pain au chocolat. Some confiture, but no cheese, ham or anything. Breakfast room is in the basement. Overall ok for a few nights. I will stay there because it's so close to the office, otherwise I would prefer another more airy hotel, with a better breakfast when you pay 200 Euro/night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great room !”
Reviews.Author: slcheng
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last 2 nights of honeymoon. Its location is very convenience, not far from Gare Saint-Lazare and Opera. There is a supermarket on the street corner. All staffs always are very friendly and helpful with smile. Especially, we were surprised that the front desk staff help confirme our lunch reservation from restaurant call before we arrived. It was unexpected and amazing service we thought. The room we stayed was lovely, clean and wide on 5 floor. The view was great from balcony we loved. The breakfast was nice and included several French breads. The only thing we were not satisfied with was high internet fee. But you still can sitting comfortable sofa and use free Wi-Fi on lobby. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel, especially for shopping and city trip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: debfrmnj
Reviews.Content: Cons: You need adapters for chargers - all plugs are European type and internet is 15 Euros per hour. Not sure but If you bring your own computer maybe the Wii is free. Just FYI: It was no problem but fyi the rooms have very large old fashioned keys and have to be left at the front desk when you go out. Also each guest gets a box located in the office area which is secured with a key that you hold to act as a safe and all my stuff including excess Euros remained safe and sound. The Le Lavoisler is quaint in that it has been refurbished so that you feel that you are in a hotel from the period in which it was built. I love this type of atmosphere and enjoyed the common areas and rooms. Pros: Prior to our trip they answered any emailed questions promptly considering time difference. I had booked through the hotel a car service to pick us up when we arrived but we missed our connection and the hotel was the go between to get us picked up. Breakfast is lovely and was included with our room. It is continental meaning a basket of very fresh and tasty French bread and pastries, orange juice (my granddaughter swore it tasted fresh squeezed) , coffee, tea, yogurt, cereal, jams & jellies. We loved it and the man who does breakfast each morning is a sweetheart. It can be delivered to the room in 5 min. time or you can go to the little restaurant area on the bottom floor before 10:30 am. You also may order eggs & bacon for I think it was 2 Euros. All of the people covering the front desk were very helpful in telling us how to get to our planned destinations by subway and rail. They also helped us book tours. We had never been to Paris, it was my granddaughter and myself and the people manning the front desk were wonderful help to me. I really do appreciate their help!!!!!! We had a great time!!!! Hope we do get to come back for a stay. The area has plenty of restaurants close by - the Chinese restaurant next door is very good. Also there is a large full service market 1/2 block from hotel. The area is located close to the shopping area on Hausmann Boulevard. The shopping is wonderful - designers, boutiques, high-end chains. We are from the NYC area and we thought we had died and went to shoppers heaven. The hotel is close to the Metro #9 which is the St. Augustine stop. We were going to Note Dame and they advised us what Metro line to take because there was construction on the normal line. This is the kind of help you need from a hotel when you are a tourist. It was just great!!! Thank you for a wonderful time Le Lavoisler!!!!! Also we only spoke hello and goodbye, thank you, etc. but each person spoke English and in fact each French person we met went out of their way to help us understand them (almost all spoke English but we also used laughable sign language) and to get around in wonderful Paris. Hope you have as nice of time that we at at Le Lavoisler!!!!

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a good stay”
Reviews.Author: twhufc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first two nights of our honeymoon. The highlight of our stay was definitely the front desk staff - Fabienne in particular was outstanding. US Airways temporarily lost my bag and Fabienne called them several times a day until she tracked down my bag. Everyone we encountered at the front desk was welcoming and extremely helpful. As for the hotel room, the reviews led me to believe that it would be more spacious and luxurious than it actually was. It's possible that we just had a small room - I don't know. The bathroom was quite basic and there were also signs that the room needed some minor refurbishment. Our stay was perfectly fine, but I do think the hotel is really more of a 3 star place than a 4 star. The location is good (especially for exploring the Right Bank), and for Paris, the room rate was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely rooms and overall great Hotel for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: WeeBean
Reviews.Content: Just back from Paris and stayed at the La Lavoisier Hotel in the Opera district for 3 nights. We struggled to find a good hotel as many reviews had scared us about the poor quality of hotels at extortionate prices in Paris. We came across this hotel on ulookubook and due to the good reviews we thought we would give it a go. It was immediately a good impression, lovely facade and reception area. Bedrooms were also nicely decorated and quite large for Parisien hotel rooms. The rooms were clean with mostly everything you would need. Staff were quite friendly with good english. I would have liked to have an in room safe and tea/coffee making facilities as it was a 4 star hotel. The price was reasonable for Paris at just under £300 for 3 nights. The location was safe and close to some lovely restaurants and the metro. It was within 15 minutes walk from the Opera and Place de la Concord. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: World69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights with my wife and my daughter Very nice and clean room, also quite large compared with other hotels in Paris. Helpful staff and good breakfast included in the rate. Located at walking distance from most important Paris beauties and shoppings. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelers33
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. We love the location, price, decor and the friendly and helpful employees. Fabienne (absolutely adorable) has been there both times. Our grand-daughter who was with us on our first stay about 4 years ago, still talks about her.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Lavoisier”
Reviews.Author: luvbug1011
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was exactly what my fiance and I had in mind for our first trip to Paris. Located in a great location, on a quiet side street, near the main tourist sites and within walking distance of many shops and boutiques. The staff were all very accommodating, and breakfast was perfect, set in a cozy subterranean vault. We highly recommend for any reason or length stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mcg1023
Reviews.Content: Huge (for Paris) room, great price, wonderful, attentive service and perfect Right Bank location for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ranmalie
Reviews.Content: We were surprised how spacious and comfortable the rooms were for a boutique hotel in Paris! The rooms were clean and cosy. The staff from the reception to the breakfast room were exceptional, friendly and extremey helpful. The breakfast wasgood, but nothing special, cheese, fruits and pastries. The location was great, lots of restaurants and cafes right outside and only about half a block to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Shanevii
Reviews.Content: Trying to choose a room in Paris was surpriningly scary. We looked at all price ranges from $190. to $600., and alot of the higher priced ones had very negative reviews. My wife found this one and we were so happy with our choice. The rooms were not large but very tasteful, and plenty of room for my wife's excessive luggage! We were not looking for an "american" style hotel we wanted a Paris experience. We paid around $250.US and were very satisfied with the experience. The location although perhaps not perfect was great for us, we like to walk, and when you get tired the "M" is very close by. Don't be scared, the Metro is very easy to figure out, and will take you anywhere-quickly! If you like Italian food there is a great spot acroos the street around the corner!! If you can find it try "Bugsy's" for food and drink! It is close!! Thank You!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTLeaves
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome awaits you from reception, lovely clean rooms with pretty décor. The location is perfect, situated in a quiet street yet close to metro, major shopping areas, easy walk to Champs Elysée and Eiffel Tower. Good restaurants and supermarket near by. I have stayed here twice and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful French hotel - great location, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: silverbullet61
Reviews.Content: My 12-year-old daughter and I stayed here for almost a week. The room was spacious and although it was on the street side the windows were so thick we heard nothing. All the people who worked at the hotel were amazingly helpful and informed. The location could not be better. We walked everywhere. We highly recommend two nearby restaurants - L'envue and Sushi World. Avoid Pepiniere, a nearby brassiere. We enjoyed the breakfast and it helped us start the sight-seeing day.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly Boutique Hotel: very Parisian and understated”
Reviews.Author: Corylus
Reviews.Content: If want large rooms with mini bars and electric kettles go and stay in one of the many branded chain hotels that may adequately cater for your needs. This is a small, friendly and very French hotel in a good location with a quiet understated elegance. The twin room that we had for two nights had most comfortable and beautifully dressed beds - it's size and ambience was in keeping with the location - traditional and very French. The latter extended to the bathroom - pristine with floors and tiles of marble, quality fittings, towels, soaps and shampoos. The reception staff are delightful, charming and helpful with fluent English that puts my poor French to shame! Breakfast is served in the basement - a small intimate room - a good selection of breads and croissants with attendant jams and honey etc, together with set yoghurt and orange juice. You can also get cooked breakfast if you prefer. Other guests were present when we were eating were French, Belgian and Italian. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Safety net hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Battersea
Reviews.Content: Having been caught in the volcanic ash disruption across europe...and, with the usual suspects of hotels being completely full...I had to book with the Hotel Le Lavoisier Opera as it was the only hotel in the 8th available. OK...I also had to pay for a junior suite at EURO 350+...but, better to have a place to sleep than not at all! I arrived at the hotel which was simple to find just around the corner from the metro and a few minutes walk from Madelaine/St Lazarre. It seemed small and quaint. I was given the juniour suite (room 100) off the main reception. It was large, with an odd extra room which at one time was an outdoor balcony now closed off and containing a small chaisse lounge chair-bed, table and scary portrait. No view...a wall but it was sound proofed. Large bathroom w/ marble floors and great towels/bathrobes w/ R&G soaps. Large comfy King Bed...two plasma tv's and ample closet space. It was dark (no natural light) but clean and surprisingly quiet at midnight. I slept well..in part because I knew I was lucky to have a room! The next morning...heard lots of noise from the reception hall (marble floors and high heels...sound travels!)...I had breakfast in the basement (great petit dejuener...croissants/coffee/muesli/etc...only on the last day did I learn you could also order a hot breakfast) Overall...it was a perfectly adequate hotel, and apart from being forced to book the suite - it was clean and comfortable. HOWEVER, the best thing about the hotel...Fabienne. The receptionist during the day. She was a pleasure to know. Very helpful...friendly and efficient. A wonderful smile for a weary and frustrated traveller. The hotel was flexible and efficient in helping with bookings, information and local knowledge. The room cleaning was prompt and efficient. The breakfast service too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the 8th but who is not looking for a boutique or impersonal stay. The rooms do not have minibars...and, the decor is not modern. But - it is clean and comfortable. I wouldnt book the suite again...and, other guests at breakfast said the upper rooms with windows were lovely. Thumbs up for the Le Lavoisier... thanks for helping my emergency stay comfortable. I never felt 'stuck' in paris or having to suffer an inconvenience while in your hands. I hope others feel the same.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good hotel”
Reviews.Author: phil081
Reviews.Content: We have visited Paris to spend christmas holidays. We chose the Lavoisier as opinions were quite good and rooms seemed to be very nice. Rooms were small, bathroom so simple, as toiletries. It was comfortable, clean and extremely well-located. In any case, if you find a good rate and you find good location, this is a good election but don't trust completely in the photos as they seem more that really they are.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael2935
Reviews.Content: Small, nice design, super friendly and accommodating. Great internet special...room and breakfast (ttc) was only 140 Euros. Highly recommend. First floor room was quiet and very comfortable with a great terrace. Free wi-fi was the only thing missing but I was able to pirate someone else's signal, so I guess I got free wi-fi anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic journey to Paris, hotel le Lavoisier worst than expected”
Reviews.Author: silviahg
Reviews.Content: We have recently visited Paris to spend christmas holidays. We chose the Lavoisier as opinions were quite good and rooms seemed to be very nice. Prices for 4 stars in Paris when the hotel is in a good location are high so I decided to pay 170 €/night thinking this hotel was very nice. To be sincere, the hotel is nice but I found everything worst than expected. Rooms were small, bathroom so simple, as toiletries. I had to ask for toothpaste and toothbrush and they gave me one as a first attemp (we were two, please!!). Breakfast without any special hot food or fruits or ham or cheese, not even hot bread or toasted. Maybe I was used to big hotels in USA (my last trip was to West Coast in summer) or 5 stars in Tarragona in september. I don't want to say the hotel is not nice but I think the property must think if benefits are made by eliminating too much services. It was comfortable, clean and extremely well-located but as I saw a lot of hotels which seemed to be similar in that area, I don't think I repeat this stay. Regarding the staff, not rude of course but not specially nice. When I asked about the size of the rooms they told me to be happy as I had got a very good price and I had been given a good room. I found this comment totally unappropiate so nothing is said about this when you book and nothing is said about any kind of offer. It was like "don't complain, we are so generous...?" In any case, if you find a good rate and you find good location, this is a good election but don't trust completely in the photos as they seem more that really they are.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: willy b
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with a fantastic location close to all the main attractions of Paris. Very friendly reception, the room was very nice ( not to big) but very clean. The breakfast was typicaly french but very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,cozy,but some of the stuff is rude”
Reviews.Author: renevouy
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the location was great. It is centrally located and you can use the subway to navigate around the city. People could be more friendly. It doesn't cost anything and it could get them better reviews, and therefore more guests. Price was also acceptable. The breakfast was cheap, such a disappointment if you want to start your day strong. If one doesn't mind the negatives it's a good choice of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just a very Pleasent Stay !”
Reviews.Author: justbegantotravel
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for 3 nights, 4 days between 30-Oct/02-Nov 2009(top floor). We choosed this hotel simply because of the location, quality/price ratio and for the rooms. We were not mistaken ! We used Rossybus from CDG Airport that directly comes to Madaliene and is only 15 minutes nice walk to the hotel. We walked to Champselysees, Louvre, Printemps, Lafayette and Seine River easily. The room was realy nice, well kept and nice decoration, clean and proper size. We slept like dead so nice beds. The staff was wellcoming and polite. Just to note there is no room service but you can take your own drinks(alchol incl.) from it's bar. So no argument about whether the room service is expensive or not ! The breakfast is nice we loved the yougurt and fruit salad+musli but please note that there is no cheese, salam or egg(all extra). Overall it was a very pleasent stay and we recommend it to other Paris visitors.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: DCtrekker
Reviews.Content: As we were heading to Bordeaux for a week at a beautiful rental home, we didn't want to kill our wallets with an additional expense for a four- day stay in Paris ,which is not a cheap city to stay in to begin with. Amex Platinum card hotels were running an average of 400 Euros per night. Fortunately, we had heard of Le Lavoisier from a friend who has lived in Paris for years and recommends it frequently. On the Blvd Malesherbes in the 8th, between St. Augustin and La Madelaine, you'll find this quiet hotel. Though not big and grand or a sleek boutique hotel, it does fit the bill for a well- priced, clean, and comfortable hotel with style on a quiet block near the metro. The lobby and check-in are small, personable, and well organized. The small seating area was a nice place to gather and meet. A most helpful front desk made for a welcome return each day. Thank you, Vivian and Ludwig , for your kind and reliable recommendations. Loved our dinner at La Plage ! We took a suite, complete with Parisian charm, on the top floor. With its colorful curtains, a marble bath with tub and shower and French doors which opened to a view to Saint Secour in the distance, we could not go wrong. The room was clean and quiet so even if you ask for a room facing the street (for light) you should be assured a quiet stay. One possible suggestion to the staff would be to do a late afternoon fluffing of the room for your return. We later returned to the Lavoisier after the house rental in Bergerac. This time our room was a Deluxe Double room. For only 149 Euros per night (possibly a promotion) including the breakfast, you couldn't beat it! Another comfortable room choice at the hotel. I believe room #26...any in that "tier" going up would be nice Really , the only thing missing for us was some fresh fruit at breakfast. The buffet offered fresh breads and pastries, freshly squeezed juice, fruit cup (packaged), yogurt and cereal. They will happily scramble eggs for you. A little fresh fruit would be a welcome addition for the fitness conscious who have a long day of touring ahead. As always, try to remember to tip at the table even though the breakfast is included. Over all, this hotel is one that we would easily recommend to friends and family . If you want a super busy area with tons of cafes within a step or two,...head for the Latin Quarter. If nice strolls with pleasant walks to beautiful shops is a on your "to do" list ..this is your place. We're already planning our next trip and will stay at Le Lavoisier as we pass through Paris. Many thanks to the staff. The guys/DC

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding honesty, warmth, and value for money”
Reviews.Author: ParisHotel
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in the hotel for one night in Paris on our way to the South of France. Our rooms one double, and one single were very well appointed and the bathroom was completely modern clean, and the best thing of all was that the shower worked with great pressure and the hot water never ran out (all things that as an American traveler in Europe you delight in). The proximity to the Champs Elysee is perfect, you MUST have the breakfast as the bread was the best we had in all of France. What you must know is the most important fact that my brther left his jacket in the room with his passport, walet with credit cards and 500 euros cash. We did not realize this for many hours and when we called the hotel they confirmed the receipt of the jacket and passport, and we assumed not to ask about the cash as we assumed it would not be there. However when returning to the hotel a week later to retreive the jacket, walet and passport, Valerie the receptionist said the maid also turned in 500 euros in cash. What wonderful honesty and this made our wonderful experience in Paris even better. Do stay there you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Vague booking process”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtnsCO
Reviews.Content: This review is in regard to the booking process for the Hotel le Lavoisier Opera. I would have liked to have an opportunity to review the hotel itself, but we will not get that chance. I booked a room via access from the hotel’s own web site (later I found out that even though you access the hotel’s official site, the booking process is transacted through a 3rd party). During the process I specified 3 adults, and they were listed by name. The summary of the booking indicates the following: 1 Superior Room, and 3 breakfasts included each day. The Superior Room specification says “ (1 double bed) – 3 people maximum ” In the narrative it says, regarding the rooms, “ Some of them can accommodate three person adding and extra bed. ” In the comments section of the booking I noted that there were three people in our party and that we would need an additional bed. After executing the booking I sent a follow-up email to the hotel to note the need for a third bed. The response I received said “we do not have anymore extra beds available for this period as mentioned on our system reservation”. Actually, the reservation confirmation says NOTHING about a 3rd bed not being available. The hotel’s suggestion was for a Junior Suite Veranda room. It was offered at a rate reduced slightly from the public rate, but it was still 125 Euros more than the rate we had booked. Not quite a bait and switch situation, but it sure felt like it. I booked a room for my party of 3 at what we thought was a great rate of 145 Euros, only to find that the appropriate accommodation for us would actually cost 270 Euros. After some research this is what seems to be the case. IF a 3rd bed is available, the site will have a box to check indicating your preference for that option. If it is NOT available ( which apparently was the case in my booking ) there is no option box displayed on the page indicating that that option is unavailable, nor on the confirmation statement. Despite the fact that I specifically indicated 3 people in my party, and listed us by name, there is no mechanism in place to indicate that the customer’s request cannot be accommodated. I was told the following in an email from the hotel, “The fact is that when you do a booking online, the page suggests the extra bed directly if it is available (see below the example), if it doesn't appear that means we do not have anymore extra beds available.” This probably should be explained on the booking site. There is no indication on the booking site or in the confirmation statement that indicates that a 3rd bed is not available, despite listing 3 adults in the reservation request. How is one to know if they are not getting what they requested? Given our budget for the trip we were forced to cancel the reservation. I emailed the hotel and told them that we would have to cancel. There is a booking fee of 5.60 Euro listed on the site. It is charged to your credit card immediately following execution of the booking. Since the site was not clear on our accommodation, and the hotel could not provide the desired accommodation, I requested a waiver or refund of this fee. In another email I was told, “ the system you booked with doesn't belong to the hotel and we are unable to refund the booking fees. Their system is programmed this way and we are unable to change it as it doesn't belong to us. The extra beds are online only if they are available, and this is before entering the number of persons.” Though not a large sum, it appears I am out 5.60 Euro. I accessed the booking via the hotel’s web site. But, since the site is a 3rd party arrangement, the hotel has no responsibility to remedy my situation. The process stated above is very vague for the customer. How is one to know if a particular amenity is not available, in this case the 3rd bed? If I list 3 guests in the booking I would expect some indication that all three guests can or cannot be accommodated as requested. Had I not sent the hotel a follow-up email we would have arrived there to find an unsuitable situation. 3 adults cannot share one double bed. And having to buy a much more expensive room would have squeezed our budget dramatically. We would have been forced to look elsewhere for a hotel, wasting our vacation time rather than seeing the beautiful city. We were disappointed that we could not stay at the Hotel le Lavoisier Opera. Luckily this situation was found before stepping in to their lobby after a long day of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PUO
Reviews.Content: Been to Paris a number of times for business. Time to take the family. Booked 2 rooms for a family holiday in Paris for 3 nights. Booked on various site recommendations for a 4*. Not so cheap. Arrived early morning. Little hotel. 4*? Small lobby. 2 small lounges. 1 very small lift. Friendly and easy check-in. Rooms ready @ 8am! Wonderful!!! Rooms -tolerable size. Decor/furnishings - no great shakes. At least comfortable and clean. Double bed was queen bed. Twin bed room was 2 single beds joined together! Bathroom - ok I suppose. No shower curtains or barriers! We expected a lot better from a 4*. No minibar or coffee/tea corner in room. Certainly not 4*. Coffee and drinks in the lounge. Honour system. You drink then tell the reception - goes on to your bill. Breakfast in the basement. Very nice steward/waiter. Very polite and efficient and friendly. From Sri Lanka. Reception staff also very nice, polite and friendly. Helped with bookings, taxis, advise. Very central location, yet quiet. Shopping at the big stores, metro, Concorde, Opera, all walking distance within 15 min radius. Walked right upto Champs. Generally, a comfortable hotel. No drama, character. Simply - A nice little hotel in the centre of Paris. Conclusion. Accomodation 3*. Location, Service & friendliness - 5*. A bit too pricey. Unfortunately, a bit below expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: Dezzydez
Reviews.Content: Ok, have to spoil the party here, but this hotel is in my opinion a 3 star hotel and not the 4 star rating its been given. We ended up staying here because Hotel Mayfair my first choice was fully booked. Due to Paris Fashion Week and another motorshow, Lavoisier bumped their prices up even more than Hotel Mayfair but booked here anyway due to proximity to Tuileres and thought the price would be justified by the 4 star rating. It was a typical small Parisian establishment with a informal, relaxed feel in a good quiet location, round the corner from Madeleine church. Our check in was quick and efficient. The room itself was small for a 4 star, we were expecting an above average room size like Hotel Mayfair or Hotel Brighton (a 3 star). It was reasonably clean and decorated in a classic style with muted colours. (No danger of garish rooms here unless thats your cup of tea) but was starting to look a bit tatty with wear and tear. LCD TV with Sky news and CNN. Bathroom was compact, rubbish toiletries, no shower curtain. Our wardrobe doors didn't close and carpet was not replaced in the last refurb and starting to look a bit dirty, so lucky we bought slippers as they did not provide any, unlike other 4* hotels. Overall, room was disappointing for the price and 4 star rating. Service was ok and very low key, which suited us. Our main problem was with their wireless internet connection which we paid for a 24 hours pay as you connect card. The connection was very weak on the 4th floor and in the end we only got 2 hours and it went out of action for three days. Didn’t get fixed so we asked for a refund for the connection card, but Lavoisier refused saying we could come back next time and use the card again....(!?). Anyway, if you are staying at the Lavoisier, drop me an email and I would be happy to send you the internet connection card as we will not be returning to Lavoisier. Do check out a gem of a restaurant called La Carre around the corenr from the hotel, delightful good and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: CherryNj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel le Lavoisier two weeks ago for one night on our way to Provence. It was a lovely experience. Fabienne made us feel so welcome and was particularly helpful in recommending a restaurant for dinner. Our room was so quiet even though we overlooked the street. We will definitely return on other trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location ! Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: jfitzp1741
Reviews.Content: Just returned from six nights at le Lavoisier, and had a great experience. The location is outstanding . Yes, the rooms are small, but they are immaculate and very charming. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty. Many thanks to Fabienne and Nisha.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidL69
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I booked to stay in the Le Lavoiser for our Honeymoon 2-6 Sept 2008. We arrived late nearly midnight, getting from CDG Airport is a bit of a journey. We were met by the night porter who simply gave us the key for our room and sent us to bed, which considreing how tired we were it was exactly how we wanted to be treated. The room on the 6th floor was tastfully decorated but rather small but as it a small boutique hotel i wasn't expecting a travel Inn size room. The next morning we went to breakfast and was looked after wonderfully by Nisha. Breakfast is a simple affair of Bread, pasties, yogurt, fresh squeezed organe and coffee. For and additional 4 Euro you could have eggs and bacon but the breakfast was substansial to fill us both up until well after lunch. During breakfast on the first day we mentioned to Nisha that we were on honeymoon (not with a view to get anything out of it!) We returned that evening to find a bottle of Champagne waiting for us from Nisha and the Hotel. After breakfast we approached the Receptionist to see if we could change room, as it was our honeymoon, she was more than accomodating and asked us to bring our bags to reception on our way out and she would have them transfered to the new room once it was prepared. The new room was lovely, still small but we expected this. During the rest of our stay we spoke alot to Fabienne the receptionist and found her to extremely helpful and pleasant. She recommended a lovely resturant nearby called Taste La Mode (i think) which was amazing. We had one of the best meals i have ever had! The lack of a shower curtain was entertaining but we assumed that its a Parisien thing! All in all i found the Hotel to be lovely but for us what made the stay even better was the hospitaility of the Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Calm & characterful”
Reviews.Author: GTJ66
Reviews.Content: A delightful quiet hotel a short distance from Bd Haussman and close to two Metro stations. Classic decor, comfortable room, good amenities. A warm welcome from the proprietors makes the stay a very pleasant one indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended small hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: mjnbrookman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my wife. Room clean, well decorated with excellent comletely tiled bathroom. Flat screen tv connected to cable, but most channels were in French. Large bed. All staff were friendly and spoke perfect English. Ideal location for clothing shops and easy access to the Open Tours bus. Honesty bar with leather seats in the small library meant that you pour your own drinks and tell them afterwards. Very good value for money. Will definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to return "home"”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_PAL
Reviews.Content: This is my "nth" stay and return to Le Lavoisier. I consider it my home in Paris. The staff remains attentive and caring to my needs. On this past trip (3 stays in over 3 weeks), I used the Lavoisier as my landing in Europe before moving to Bordeaux (wine-country trip); returned for a week in Paris; and my wife spent her last two days in France after she visited family and I had returned home. On the last stay, I heard only great things for my wife on her two days there. This demonstrates that once more my trust in their staff is not misplaced. The Lavoisier is a smaller Paris-style hotel, with good rooms whatever size you chose. Do not expect resort-style or North American space and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: vhagan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed only 1 night at this hotel. The rooms were nice nad clean. The best part of the hotel is Fabienne the concierge. She took such great care of us. She always had a smile on and could not do enough for us. I thought she owned the hotel that's how good she was. I reccomend the hotel because of the friendly staff and it was a great location. We will diffently stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mew225
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel - centrally located, nice quiet room (even with a street view), and very helpful staff. They welcomed us and organized a wonderful dinner for us. The set up is very warm and friendly. We look forward to returning on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: arapp
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Le Lavoisier (on 21 Rue Lavoisier) is situated at a nice location near the Boulevard Haussman and Malesherbes. A relatively short walk away from some of the premier fashion avenues in Paris (Montaigne, Champs Elysees, and Faubourg Saint Honore) and also not too far from the Louvre. The staff members were very helpful and the hotel was quiet and comfortable. Room service was excellent -- we ordered breakfast to our room many times. The television did not have a wide range of channels, but worked well for the number it received. Good air conditioning as well. My only complaint involves the bathroom -- the drainage system in both the shower and the sink did not work smoothly. The shower itself had enough pressure, but within a minute, I felt a little like I was beginning to take a bath. However, this problem can easily be remedied (with a little drain-o or lye perhaps?) and should definitely not deter one from staying in this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Derrick61
Reviews.Content: We had a room at the back which looked onto a yard, this was not a problem as it made the room extremely quiet. The hotel location was perfect. We walked a few hundred yards and we were in the Place de la Concorde. The hotel was very clean and nothing was a problem, we are already thinking of booking again. Dont get me wrong, in the hotel there is no entertainment or what you would call bar, but it is the perfect reason to get out and explore this fantastic city and this hotel is in a nice area with shops and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: fancytraveller
Reviews.Content: This was a second time for me and my partner at the Lavoisier hotel. It's a four star hotel, famous department stores are 5 min. walking distance. The room was not very big, but very comfortable and complete, decorated in beautiful, elegant colours and materials. The staff was very kind and helpfull. The hotel is small, so you get a very exclusive feeling. The closest metro is 2 min. walking distance and in the vicinity there are lots of choices for eating. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No French TV, no room-service and breakfast from 7am”
Reviews.Author: Lindgren
Reviews.Content: On the positive side was the friendly lady when I arrived, the room was clean and I slept very well without being disturbed by trafic, despite the fact that the hotel is close to a grand boulevard. I arrived back at the hotel at 9 p.m. and asked for room service as I had not yet eaten. I was informed by a less friendly male receptionist there there was no room service, so I had to go out and get something elsewhere. Not a big problem, even though it was raining, but I went out to get something to bring back to the hotel for a TV dinner. I was surprised that 4 star hotel does not have any French TV channels (in Paris, France), but only CNN, Skynews (which in themselves are good) and 2 Spanish and 1 Italian channel. Having my train in the morning, I was again surprised to find that they start serving breakfast only at 7 a.m. Most hotels, having "business men" and travellers as clientel usually start at 6 or at the latest 6.30. When checking out, the same male receptionist was again not very friendly and there were no questions or concern whatsoever about whether the stay was pleasant or if everything was satisfactory. When waiting for the credit card transaction to go through, he was looking through other papers and again paid no attention to his guest. Again, I did sleep well but other than that, a very mediocre experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: starvoyager00001
Reviews.Content: In short, I was not very impressed with the hotel. The hotel is said to be a four star hotel but it seemed more like a three star hotel. I booked a standard double room which was fairly small. The bed constituted most of the room, there were a few cracks in the wall but nothing alarming, the shower did not have a shower curtain which was odd, there was nothing to suggest an upscale room besides the small flat screen TV and, quite simply put, a very average room. Certaintly not worth the price I paid for and I wish I had gotten a hostel instead. I would only recomend this place for a place to sleep but bear in mind, it is not worth the cost you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic birthday break”
Reviews.Author: audilady
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere smalland exclusive for a romantic birthday break and couldn't have picked anywhere better. The location, the staff, the decor, everything was just perfect and everything we could have wished for. Fabienne on reception even booked a table at the Ritz and organised a taxi, flowers and chocolates, all done in the most friendly and efficient way. We are certainly returning there at the first opportunity and have already recommended this hotel to several friends thinking of going to Paris. This was my first leisure visit to Paris although I had driven round it, through it and under it on many occasions. We couldn't have picked a better time to go with all the Christmas lights and the stores decorated to perfection. Everything was to hand and within walking distance and when the feet gave out, the Metro was only yards away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, sylish hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: LittleMaharani
Reviews.Content: The Lavoisier hotel is well situated close to Galleries Layfayette and Printemps. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. The room was spacious (by Parisien standards!) and beautifully decorated with thick, lined curtains and antique furniture. The windows are well insulated so we had no noise problems even facing onto the street below. The bathroom is tight but has a great shower and hairdryer. Breakfast is great (baguettes, pain au chocolate and orange juice) if it's included in your rate, otherwise it's not worth €14 per person. There is a Monoprix supermarket over the road that sells pastries for breakfast..... Reception were very helpful when making restaurant reservations. Would recommend a visit to Kim Anh Vietnamese restaurant in the 15th Arrondissement; food was fantastic and worth a small splurge (€100 for 2 courses and 2 beers!!) All in all, would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed Le Lavoisier”
Reviews.Author: Propertiesbeauty
Reviews.Content: Super small extremely friendly hotel - great central location but away from noise, hustle & bustle!! But so accessible for shopping, sightseeing and dining! Tastefully decorated rooms with elegant furnishings - I know the rooms are a little small but they certainly have everything you need. Nothing was too much trouble and breakfast and newspapers served in your room at no extra cost was a luxury! Will definitely use this hotel again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Weloveourhols
Reviews.Content: My wife surprised me with a short trip to Paris and had booked Le Lavoisier. All I can say is her choice could not have been better. The location of this Hotel is perfect, you are immediately in the heart of Paris.... walking only a few minutes and you find yourself on the Concord right in the centre of everything to see in this beautiful city. The Hotel itself is so friendly and nothing is too much trouble. Much of these review sites are a way to complain about a trip but we truely believe that an honest recommendation will help your stay in Paris be as enjoyable as ours. Thank you to our hosts for this.... and a message to the chef, sorry i didn't find out your name but it was a pleasure meeting you and hope to see you again..... and keep enjoying your music!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lavoisier”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravellers2007
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just returned from a fabulous weeks holiday in Paris staying at the Lavoisier.This is our 2nd stay at the hotel. We decided to comeback again due to the great location, extremely friendly and helpful staff . In particular Fabienne and Nisharn.They make the hotel a home away from home. They show a genuine interest in the guests ,making sure they get the best out of their holiday in Paris. Suggesting great little restaurants close by ,such as L'Envue for dinner.Laduree for high tea or lunch.Good shopping etc. Fabienne suggested other great towns to visit whilst we were in France to make the most of our 3 week holiday. Beaune , Nuit St George to name a few. My wife and I look forward to our next visit again at this great little boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Paris, but not the last we hope.”
Reviews.Author: IanLincolnEngland
Reviews.Content: We arrived early after taking the 0645 flight from East Midlands arrived at the hotel at 1000hrs, but were delighted with the welcome at reception and to be told that the room was ready for us. The room was spacious with a very comfy bed, nice compact bathroom and shower unit. Overall a very nice room on the 2nd floor. Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant, helpfull and spoke good English so I didnt use much of my limited French. The location is perfect for the Mertro and stations generally, and is easily in walking distance of all the major attractions if you so wish but in 5 days we used the Metro most of the time to avoid too much walking. Will my wife and I return I would say yes, and we would be more than happy to use the Le Lavoisier again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Le Lavoisier”
Reviews.Author: neogirl
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th trip to Paris and we read about the Hotel Le Lavoisier in an old Travel & Leisure Magazine checked it out online and e-mailed the hotel for a reservation. My husband & I enjoyed our stay. Nicely sized and well furnished, with wonderfully comfortable beds and very very clean. The entire staff is extremely helpful and very accommodating. Even though our room faced the street we slept undisturbed. The breakfast, which by the way is from 7am to 11am, was a nice touch for late sleepers and was a perfect start to our day. The location was excellent and the hotel and rooms were exactly as pictures on the hotel website. For the level of quality and staff’s ability to make you feel at home is why this hotel is highly recommended. The Bolden from Santa Monica, CA

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: dumaguete
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel everytime I am in Paris which is twice a year. In 2005, I brought 8 of my friends from the US and they all decided they will also stay in this hotel when they all go back to Paris. The staff is friendly and accomodating especially Fabienne, Nisha and Ludovic. It's great to see the same familiar faces each time, which definitely gives a meaning to the saying - "home away from home." The room is clean especially the bathroom which is very important to me. My daughter and I walk from the hotel on our way to the Louvre, Champs Elysee, the Opera et al. I will go back to this hotel again and again. Nina Bauer

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique style, but check what you have booked”
Reviews.Author: happydaysSydney
Reviews.Content: The deal booked for the Lavoiser was 6 nights in a Junior Suite with Balcony and King Bed. What we got was a room off the ground floor lobby with with a "sun room" from which no sun or light came in. When we queried it the Hotelier blamed the booking engine. Saying this, the room was spacious by Paris standards, and the hotel service and breakfast (included) was good. The room was fairly noisy from plumbing and general clanking on nearby stairs. The decor was very tasteful, the bathroom was great. The location is a nice walk from the subway, Galeries Lafayatte and the Opera area, and is convenient to various dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: benoilberg
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay - what a delight. Hotel is very well located - very near two metro stations. We got the roissy bus from the airport and found the hotel with ease. Our room was on the fifth floor - it may have been slightly smaller than we were expecting, however it was very clean, had a great view, and also had a welcome veranda. Would highly recommend the hotel - the receptionists speak good english and were always more than helpful. If we go back to Paris then we will be sure to stay at the Le Lavoisier.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Lavoisier - an intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmarvelous
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Le Lavoisier with 2 other couples on a quick 3 night trip to Paris. We were very pleased with our experience. The rooms were roomy by European standards and very clean. The location is a bit off the "beaten" tourist path...but still in walking distance to several major attractions and close to a metro line. The location gives you a more local feel. We requested and received early check ins and rooms on higher floors based on recommendations from this web site. Our rooms were on the 5th floor. Our room faced the street side with a balcony and with the french door open you could hear street noises (not overly loud) but with the door closed it was nice and quiet. Our friends both had rooms on the courtyard side and said their rooms were quiet. The bathrooms did not have shower curtains - which is vry common in European hotels but often a surprise to the American traveler. The staff were all extremely friendly and spoke perfect English. They made us feel right at home. The only negative that I can even mention is the 28 euros for the contintental breakfast----their are so many nice cafes in the general vicinity- it really is not worth it. We took advantage of this only on the last day on a Sunday morning when all the local cafes were closed and we were on our way to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Personally.. .”
Reviews.Author: cathching
Reviews.Content: They have an excellent personal service, I wish that they mentioned however that breakfast was not included, because I had to pay 12 euros per head. Apart from that, I loved the room. Although it was on the 3rd floor it was a quiet room and the location is perfect for shoppers! Very friendly staff and they try their best to accomodate your requests whatever they may be.

Reviews.Title: “So nearly excellent”
Reviews.Author: nontourist
Reviews.Content: Charming people in a great location (for which you pay a premium price) but spoilt by three things: 1 - Pillows - foam filled and more in keeping with a one star hotel. They could not supply any alternative 2 WiFi - yes but at a price - ALL hotels not having free WiFi (like towels and soap !) should be boycotted. 3 Bathroom cleaning could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel But Substandard Beds and Pillows”
Reviews.Author: larover
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it. There are 3 common areas in the lobby to sit and read the multi language newspapers they provide for free or have a drink at the honor bar and meet other guests. It is quite lovely. The staff from the concierge to Nishan who serves breakfast to the maids are incredibly friendly and helpful. We were here for 7 nights and had a junior suite facing the back of the hotel. There were two large French windows overlooking a quaint church steeple and a rather ugly modern building. However we chose this room for the extra room and because we wanted a quiet room. That it was…..exceptionally quiet. One of the quietest hotel rooms I have ever had and I truly appreciated the quiet. We slept each night with the windows wide open and were not disturbed. The maid did show us other rooms as we spoke a great deal to her in French. By the way everyone at the hotel with the possible exception of the maids spoke exceptional English. The other rooms were much more charming than the junior suites which another reviewer pointed out although the suites had the larger bed (actually two beds pushed together with a barely perceptible crack between them). Breakfast was quite good and in relation to the cafes in the area I found it to be worth the money….14 euros for a baker’s basket, fresh orange juice, unlimited coffee and tea, yogurt and cereals and 3 euros more for bacon and eggs. They will also give you extra croissants and pastries at no additional cost. The cafes nearby charged anywhere from about 6 euros and up for one cup of coffee (extra cups at about 3 euros a piece) one croissant and a cup of juice. So if you eat a large breakfast the hotel breakfast is worth it. We only went elsewhere because we wanted a change of pace since we were at the hotel for 7 nights. Most days we didn’t eat again until dinner because we were so full. You are quite close to the Place St Augustin metro station and the metro in Paris is very comprehensive and easy to use. However we walked quite a bit…..to the Arc,, Tour Eifel, Louvre, D’orsay and left bank. These are far walks but great exercise and very interesting walks. The hotel is quite close to the Opera Garnier and Gallerie Lafayette. There are also several cafes nearby most of which we found to be relatively pricey and so so. The best of the lot was café St Augustin which was pretty good, great French fries and we thought worth the money for what you got. We also had Won Ton Soup at the Asian restaurant next door and it was very good soup. Most other meals we ate out of the area using the Zagat guide as our source which was dead on.....[--]. As many other reviewers noted there is a Monoprix in the next block where you can buy water and sodas and other things at normal prices. There is no refrigerator in the room but you can get ice downstairs at no charge. The only criticism I have of this hotel is as other reviewers pointed out we found the mattress to be lumpy and not as comfortable as they should have been. The pillows were also fairly hard foam like pillows and when we asked there were no other pillows….ie feather or down. I would not say the bed was incredibly uncomfortable and we did get used to it and slept very well. We are relatively young however and I am not sure others who might be older of have bad backs, etc would be as adaptable to the beds as we were. We were scheduled to only stay here for 5 nights and then check into the Grand Hotel for 2 nights but rather than repack and move hotels we cancelled the Grand and stayed at Lavoisier for an additional 2 nights so obviously the beds were livable. However it would have been nice to look forward to a very comfy bed and pillows to sink into at night. I would most likely stay at this hotel again if I want to be in the 8th Androissment. After checking things out and walking around I think quiet parts of the 7th might be very appealing as well. Overall this is a very nice hotel for the money with a very friendly and helpful staff and perhaps they will improve on the bed situation in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Expected and More”
Reviews.Author: carolinians
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris was made even better than we imagined by our decision to stay at Hotel Le Lavoisier. We have traveled extensively at quite luxurious levels to many other parts of Europe and elsewhere in the world, even eastern France, but somehow had not been able to get to to this historic and beautiful city before. We have very high standards and expectations, but decided on this trip to avoid the luxury hotels and seek a more intimate and hopefully still attractive, friendly, and comfortable BOUTIQUE STYLE LODGING for this trip. This rennovated and updated townhome once owned by the French scientist Lavoisier was a WONDERFUL FIND. On our arrival and every day thereafter we were greeted warmly by the gracioius staff who made us (and every other guest that we observed arrive or depart during our stay) feel that we were who they had been waiting for. As a couple who hates (in spite of our preparatory research) to have every minute scheduled before they arrive and who like to make it up as we go along, the hotel's CONCIERGE SERVICES, especially Fabienne and Ludovic, were really the proverbial" icing on our cake," providing us with EXCELLENT advice and service in every category you can imagine. They enjoyed my attempts to communicate in rusty basic French, and warmly responded in perfect English (& for other nationalities in a mutually understood language). They arranged for all our delightful dining experiences, willingly reviewed and culled our well researched list with us and even added some wonderful ideas of their own, which turned out to be excellent. They helped us to find the most convenient and (where requested) cost effective ways to see and experience as much of their fabulous city as possible in the week we had there. Whatever level of service we requested, they found a source for us and the quality was always excellent and did not disappoint. We especially enjoyed our outing to Versailles arranged by the hotel. We traveled by minivan in the company of three other English speaking couples from Canada and Australia with a young Frenchman as our driver and professional guide. His knowledge and ability to share it were "incroyable!" Every morning NIsha greeted us in Lavoisier's cheerful, cozy lower level cafe with his freshly brewed coffee in our own little pot and our own baker's basket of many fresh breads. The hotel offered this and more daily at the CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST buffet (INCLUDED in the price of the room) with more selections than one would expect in a small boutique hotel. (For those who choose to go elsewhere and want a full breakfast, numerous cafes are just steps away in any direction.) One evening we sat and enjoyed cocktails in the relaxing and elegant self-serve, HONOR BAR tucked just off the lobby with another couple staying at the hotel. It was then we planned our cocktail hour outing with them to the Ritz Bar toward the end of our stay. The LOCATION of this CHIC hotel is terrific, too, just a few minutes walk north of the Place de La Concorde, with the Champs Elysee in one direction and the Tuileries and Louvre in the other, just a few minutes from one of the "hop on/hop off" tour bus companies main stops, and just south of Hausmann and a taxi stand, the metro, Rue Faubourg, the Opera Garnier and the French department stores. Each day after roaming the streets, museums, historic sights, gardens,shops and restaurants, we returned to the comfort of our spotlessly CLEAN room with its SOPHISTICATED DECOR, COMFORTABLE BED with plump, soft pillows and lovely, up to date MARBLE BATH. We had asked when making reservations to be on the quieter side of the building away from the street and our request was honored without hesitation. The hotel is located just off Malsherbe and a bit north of the Madeleine Church in an area that is fairly quiet in the evenings anyway. It was nice to have the choice to enjoy the two grand French door style windows open or closed, when we needed the air conditioning system on a couple of warm September nights. No doubt, Hotel Le Lavoisier for $199 Euros per night was a major reason we enjoyed our wonderful visit to Paris. Since you cannot do Paris in one week, we must return to explore some more. When we return, we would definitely stay at Le Lavoisier again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: khkh
Reviews.Content: Found a good package rate for this and a couple hotels in Provence through General Tours. There were two of us - I have been to Paris many times, my friend had not. We were very happy with this choice. The area is quiet and calm and seems to be mostly offices in beautiful old buildings. That cut down on the atmosphere of the area somewhat but the proximity to most of the must-see sites makes up for that. Our room was lovely and we routinely flooded the bathroom - not a big deal! Highly recommended for folks who don't need/want to be in the midst of hub-bub (I would probably stay over in the 7th at the Du Cadron but the rate we got with GT was so good we couldn't pass it up). Breakfast was good - service great, lighting dim.

Reviews.Title: “Le Lavoisier, classy,cool and chic.,”
Reviews.Author: robstef
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Lavoisier with my wife and 9 year old daughter for two nights in July 2006, This is a quite delightful hotel and we will definitely return. Price is reasonable for Paris.The hotel is spotlessly clean and the room we had (on 3rd floor) was certainly not huge but took a double bed and an extra bed for my daughter easily with still some space to move around. Having said this my son and his wife were staying in the hotel at the same time (we had, unknowingly, booked into the hotel at the same time - synchronicity or what?) and his room, allegedly a suite with a jacuzzi bath did seem a little cramped and dingy. The only natural light was from a little ante-room, the window of which looked straight out onto a wall of the next building. Nonetheless, it was, as our room was, nicely furnished. The bathrooms were excellent, all white marble and tiles, and again, very clean. This hotel was a Town House and it still manages to retain some of the feel of that, yet at the same time with a modern touch. It has class. Someone has taken some care over the decor and furnishings. While we were there, it was a heat wave. Thank goodness then for the very efficient air conditioning in the rooms. After a day dashing round the tourist sites it was like coming back to an oasis. So cool! The Hotel is well situated - it really is in a quiet side street. There is no traffic noise. The metro is just round the corner as is a very impressive supermarket. One or two good restaurants to be found in the area too. Last but not least, the staff. The two young women who were on duty at the reception during our time there could not have been more helpful, charming, knowledgeable and just plain delightful. As a bonus, they were also attractive, sexy and chic (hope they don't mind me saying so). It would be wrong not to mention the breakfast ( which was more than adequate) and the absolutely charming guy who was serving. We had a terrific stay at this hotel and much of this was down to the efficiency and courtesy of the staff. In terms of hotels in this class, in this price bracket, Le Lavoisier must be hard to beat. I really hope they manage to sustain this level of service (at least until I get to stay there again).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a few reservations”
Reviews.Author: radform
Reviews.Content: 4 of us styed here at the end of July. I agree with lots of the reviews on the site, but just consider the following. We booked a Junior suite and a deluxe room. The Suite on the first floor faced the back of the building - which was a wall!! the room was ok, but so dark & of course no view. We asked to be moved & they helped us immediately. We looked at 2 rooms with views. On the first and 5th floors. Yes you get a tiny balcony on the 5th - but we decided on the 1st floor because the bathroom was bigger and the larger windows let loads more light into the room. The view wasn't that great, so it didn't really matter. The breakfast room was a bit small and dark, but the breakfast was ok.. don't go for the eggs & bacon - it's just not worth it... We missed not having a bar in the hotel - but it wasn't a big deal. Nice enough place... but I'd try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: westielvr
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with excellent service. The rooms are small compared to North American standards, but very comfortable and well appointed. There is no shower curtain in the bathroom, so be careful not to get the entire bathroom wet! If you need an iron and board, you can ask for one at the front desk. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel - very expensive at 14 euros. You can walk up the street to one of the cafes and get a continental breakfast for half the price. There is a lovely cozy lounge on the ground level - perfect for an evening nightcap. It's an honour bar, so you help yourself and just let the front desk know what you had. Great selection. OTHER PARIS OBSERVATIONS Warning: taxis can be hard to come by - if you reserve one in advance, there is an additional 8 euro charge to your fare. My advice: there is a taxi stand at the corner of Malesherbes and Haussman - wait there for a cab and don't pay extra. Otherwise, take the "metro" or walk. Parisiens are not known for their warmth and friendliness, so don't be offended if you encounter some rather rude people. I speak fluent French and still got attitude! I found that generally people don't take the time to listen and ensure they understood your needs, so don't be surprised if you don't always get exactly what you asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Lavoisier lacking”
Reviews.Author: damienc
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to get rave reviews and they are to some extent justified by the location,the ambience and the staff or most of them. We found one of the front office personnel to be arrogant and unhelpful. I guess it's part of the charm of Paris and not that big a deal. But I would sound one cautionary note about this hotel. The mattress in our room was as hard as a rock and certainly not conducive to a restful night's sleep. If hard mattresses are your thing then the Lavoisier would be your perfect hotel. But if you are like me and can only sleep in a comfortable bed you might want to consider one of the other highly recommended hotels. Maybe the hotel owners will read this and replace their mattresses. On a more positive note the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June/06 for 7 nights. Booked online via the official website for a "Superior" room. Our rate included breakfast (2 people). All hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. It is a small hotel, so it felt cozy and not as impersonal as a larger chain-type hotel. Our room was very clean. The area is quiet and felt safe; rue Lavoisier is off Malherbes. Location is convenient - Monoprix grocery/ drugstore is nearby, it's a 15-20 minute walk to Opera Garnier and the department stores, 20-30 minute walk to the Champs Elysees. Nearest subway station was St Augustin or Madeleine. Breakfast was good, especially the fresh-squeezed OJ. Our room had air conditioning, a small tv in the closet, hair dryer, and a small desk with chair. Only a few minor issues - no shower curtain in the bathroom, the bed was a bit sunk in the middle, and our window faced another building. Some other rooms appeared a bit better in terms of size and view, but overall we were very happy with the Laovisier and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: rickLondon_Uk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a terrific stay at Le Lavoisier. Got a good on line deal which included breakfast. This is a very classy hotel, full of nice touches (library) and a really friendly, welcoming staff. Our room on the top floor faced the back, so no great views but it was so quiet. Paris was blisteringly hot the weekend we stayed, but as we hate air conditioning we just opened the bedroom windows and we still had the most blissfully quiet room! The double (queen sized) bed was large and comfortable, breakfasts were perfect - fresh croissants, baguettes and brioches, fresh orange juice etc. The hotel is in a wonderful location, very close to Madeleine and all the smart boutiques and food shops, including a fantastic wine store called Lavinia. You are also close to some major Paris sights - Champs Elysees, Concorde, Tuileries, Louvre etc. We will definitely stay here again. For any interested vegetarians out there, we managed to have two really good meals within walking distance from hotel. Firstly, Maceo (about a 20 minute walk) actually has a small vegetarian menu alongside the usual meat/fish items. Food and ambience absolutely superb. Also much closer to the hotel (about 5 minutes walk) a place called L'envue also had a vegetarian sample plate. Food really good, but Maceo is the one I would choose for a really great foodie night out. Both places have their own website. Currently two great exhibitions close to one another - Cindy Sherman and 20th Century Italian Art. A wonderful hotel and what a wonderful weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “A 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: bennbient
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and found it rather disappointing. The staff are friendly and helpful, but no more than what we've encountered elsewhere. The room was clean but average. No fridge, no safe or shower curtain and only a tiny and tatty looking television. The "kingsize bed" was actually two beds pushed together. The matresses were very uncomfortable. Nothing about the place delighted us, or exceeded our expectations. We had requested a non-smoking room on a high floor. We were allocated a smoking room on the second floor. We were left with the choice of staying there or moving to another, but smaller, smoking room. Incidentally, we were told that all rooms have ashtrays as standard. Reception informed us that the housekeeper would spray the room with deodoriser. It wasn't the response we wanted to hear. There was no hot water for two of the three days. This was explained as something to do with public works in the city. We have never encountered this before in a 4 star hotel. The breakfast room is in the basement. No natural light, and the ambience is on the drab side. It's possibly the saddest room we've ever ate in. On the plus side, the hotel is in a reasonable neighbourhood and the metro is nearby. Paris is a great place, and we had a wonderful time in the city. Based on the reviews, though, Le Lavoisier was a disappointment. Given the chance, we would probably book Hotel Sezz or Hotel Esprit Saint Germain.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Paris, and we took a long time deliberating over the hotel. We were not disappointed. The hotel is very conveniently located, close to the Metro, and within walking distance of many places of interest. We were struck by the cleanliness of the hotel, and of our room, although had some initial disappointment as our room did not appear to be the one we booked. On subsequent reflection, we feel that this was probably more a fault of the Expedia room descriptions than anything else. The hotel staff were certainly helpful in changing our room, and we had absolutely no complaints about the comforts of our stay. This was in fact a consistent theme throughout our stay - the hotel staff were delightful and exceptionally helpful, even down to pulling out the stops to find us a room for an extra night at the end of our stay. We were surprised that the rooms had no coffee-making facility, but this is a minor quibble. The typically French breakfasts were always fresh, enjoyable and served by one of the friendliest waiters we have ever met. In short, Hotel le Lavoisier and its staff contributed towards an outstanding and memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but skip breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: survivorfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Lavoisier in May 2006 and thought it was extraordinarily clean and had a unique contemporary, sophisticated style. We thought the front desk staff was helpful in making suggestions, giving directions, etc. However, the way that the menu in the breakfast room is written, it looks like the breakfast is included and that just eggs and bacon are extra. The reason why I say this is because there are no prices anywhere for the normal breakfast...but there are prices to add eggs and bacon. So...we ended up paying 14 euros EACH for two adults for each of two days, plus a fee each day for the child when she took two bites. In other words, we thought that the crossiants and coffee were included but about 72 euros showed up on our bill for crossiants that we thought were included. What an assumption on my part! I assumed that since there were no prices listed for anything except eggs and bacon, that everything else was complimentary. The room was extremely crowded with the cot for a triple room. You'd think a triple room would be bigger than a double, but hey...that's Europe. I also had espected a shower curtain, but this was not the case either. We sat in the tub and sprayed ourselves (and the rest of the small bathroom). I probably should have asked for one, but I didn't want to typify the preconceived notions of Americans. I, however, was impressed with the cleanliness and front desk service. The hotel was located in a convenient location to get to all the sights and right around the corner from a metro station. As far as cost, it was high at 204 euros per night, but we went in the peak season when rates in Europe are usually double, so most everything else in the vicinity was high priced also. The beds were the best part because they were actually quite comfortable! Overall, a good deal (with the exception of the breakfast) and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jur
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend Le Lavoisier. Very friendly staff and great location. Don't take room 100 a the ground floor but all other rooms are OK.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel with Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: barbaranyegaard
Reviews.Content: Le Lavoisier in Paris is a four star hidden jewel. I booked the hotel through Travel Intelligence and received a 350 euros dinner at the fantastic "La Maison Blanche" restaurant on Avenue Montaigne as part of the 700 euro two night package. The hotel is small, very quiet, discreet and provided excellent service. In just five minutes you can walk to great shopping (Galeries Lafayette), Jardin de Tuilleries, the Concorde and the Louvre. This is where I'll be staying from now on. A great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a night in romantic Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked here for a surprise night away with my fiance. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and they all spoke excellent English. Our room was very spacious and tasteful. And it is also in a great location! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find in a great area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: GuelphMarlene
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris many times ,but finding a nice ,clean hotel at a reasonable price is often difficult to find.We found this hotel through the internet and the pictures looked great but we all know they aren't always reliable.I'm happy to say that this time they were.The hotel is elegant ,clean and the service was delightful.Our rooms were on the upper floors and facing a busy street, but we heard no noise at all and were able to get a good night's sleep.The breakfasts were very good and they were plentiful.This is a fantastic hotel and near the opera and the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magic.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment my girlfried and I arrived outside the hotel to the moment we left, I knew I had made a great choice. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. Even at breakfast time when your still half sleeping they were great. I cant praise the hotel enough. Nice clean rooms which were very tastefully decorated, ideal for a romantic break. We walked everywhere, Hotel was ideally located for this no need for transport. You get to see the bits of Paris then that aren't on the maps which makes for a better trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good; Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: EliDC
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Le Lavoisier over the weekend Jan 13-15. We had 3 rooms (two suites and a double room) for a group of 6 adults and 5 children all 5 years and under. Not an easy group, but the hotel was wonderful. The location is excellent. The suites were perfect for families with small children because you can put the kids in an adjoining room. The regular room was a little small especially with the extra bed. The staff was really great. The best experience I have had in Paris (and we have stayed in a dozen hotels or more). They managed to find great restaurants for our very mixed group of 11 (Bouef sur le Toit particularly) and they were terrific with the kids. If you need big rooms, I would recommend the St.Petersbourg or the Hotel D'Orsay, but for excellent staff, beautiful rooms and great location you can't beat the Le Lavoisier.
